chapter.title: OpenIDM Compatibility
chapter.para: This chapter covers both major changes to existing functionality, and also deprecated and removed functionality.

section.title: Major Changes to Existing Functionality
section.para: The following changes will have an impact on existing deployments. Read these changes carefully and adjust existing scripts and clients accordingly.

listitem.para: The way in which scheduled tasks is configured has changed, as described in Scheduling Tasks and Events.
Schedules are now defined in files named openidm/conf/schedule-*.json. If you use the previous naming convention (scheduler-*.json), the schedules will not be launched.

In previous releases, reconciliation was called on the sync service. This API has been deprecated and reconciliation is now called on the recon service. For example, a reconciliation operation that previously targeted the following URL:
would now use the following URL:
Timestamps now have milliseconds and are in UTC timezone.

The access log now has an additional field, userid, which is the OpenIDM ID for a managed or internal user who is logged in. For authentication via SSL mutual auth only, the userid is currently null because there is no direct associated user in OpenIDM.
The reconID column has been removed from the links table.
The size of the linkType column in the links table has been reduced to 255 characters. This is because MySQL can only create unique indexes on that size for UTF-8 encoding.
The links table indexes have been changed to unique indexes to prevent duplication.

varlistentry.term: Changes to token definitions in OrientDB query definitions

listitem.para: Existing repo.orientdb.json query definitions with tokens like ${mytoken} must be reviewed and adjusted to match the new definition which aligns declarations for regular and prepared statement uses.

Existing ${token} tokens are now suitable for quoted strings by default. Prefixes such as unquoted: and dotnotation: allow you to use queries in contexts where the unquoted value or the JSON pointer converted to OrientDB dot notation should be inserted.
query-by-linkType
The request context now includes the security context of the user that is associated with the call.
The "user" property has been renamed "username", the name used to log in (for example, to authenticate against an access manager).

section.title: Minor Changes to Existing Functionality
section.para: The following changes should not have an impact on existing deployment configurations.

varlistentry.term: Connection pooling is on by default

listitem.para: For existing configurations, keep this setting off unless you explicitly require it to be changed.

varlistentry.term: Explicit definition of username, password, and role

listitem.para: The authentication configuration now explicitly defines which properties from the query represent the username, password, and role. Existing configurations rely on the logic of the query order to determine which property is which.

varlistentry.term: Prefetching of links during reconciliation operations

listitem.para: All links are now queried at the start of a correlation and the results of that query are used.
For more information, see Prefetching Links in the Integrator's Guide.

section.title: Deprecated Functionality

itemizedlist.para: The following functionality is deprecated in OpenIDM .

listitem.para: Reconciliation is no longer called on the sync service. For more information, see the list of changes to existing functionality.

section.para: No additional functionality is planned to be deprecated at this time.

section.title: Removed Functionality
section.para: No functionality has been removed in OpenIDM .
No functionality is planned to be removed at this time.

section.title: Functionality That Will Change in the Future

itemizedlist.para: These capabilities are expected to change in upcoming releases:

listitem.para: The way you generate connector configurations for access to external resources, described in Creating Default Connector Configurations.
